column5: We are heading up to Chamberlain Narrows next Saturday. Any recent reports from up there. I hear the water is pretty low.Anyone have rock problems.Thanks

We were in that area last week. At the north end near Tom's Landing there is a rock marked with a small white buoy, looks like someone's boat bumper. Going north toward Merit there is a sand spit that runs between a couple islands into the main channel. The water is shallow across most of it, as low as two feet or so, but by crowding the west side island, you should be fun. Just go slow when the depth comes up.
